intro: Gongronema glabriflora, commonly known as the smooth-flowered gongronema, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
